title: These 5 Amazon KDP Keyword Mistakes Are Killing Your Book Sales

tactics.name: Avoid Banned Keywords
tactics.description: Amazon KDP prohibits specific keywords like quality claims, time-sensitive terms, Amazon program names, and misrepresentation.
steps: Exclude words like 'best', 'new', 'Kindle Unlimited', or other brand names
source_quotes: You can't use the word book. And probably most importantly, you can't use any sort of misrepresentation.

tactics.name: Use Unique Keywords
tactics.description: Avoid repeating keywords in title/subtitle and keyword slots to maximize real estate.
steps: Use distinct keywords in title, subtitle, and seven keyword slots
source_quotes: If your book title is gratitude journal for women, there's no reason to use the words gratitude or journal in any of your seven keyword slots.

tactics.name: Target Long-Tail Keywords
tactics.description: Replace broad keywords with specific, niche terms to improve discoverability.
steps: Replace 'planner' with 'fitness planner for busy moms'
source_quotes: If you're not being as narrow as you possibly can with your keywords, Amazon really will have no idea who to serve up your particular book to.

tactics.name: maximize_keyword_real_estate
tactics.description: Fill every character in keyword slots with relevant keywords, even if they seem unrelated, to maximize Amazon's keyword crawling efficiency.
steps: Use all available characters in each keyword slot
Combine longtail keywords with additional relevant terms
source_quotes: If you've got a keyword slot and you've got your even if it's a longtail keyword in there and you've still got half a slot left, put additional keywords in the back end...

heuristics.name: Validate Keyword Demand
heuristics.condition: If a keyword lacks search volume data, penalize its use
source_quotes: It's no good if only one or two people are searching for that keyword.

heuristics.name: boost_low_review_books
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize keyword optimization to improve visibility
source_quotes: they were books that hadn't made sales in months and then they all started to sell again

claims.statement: Amazon KDP bans keywords like 'bestseller' and 'Kindle Unlimited'
source_quotes: You can't say things like new, on sale, or available now. You can't talk about any Amazon program names.

claims.statement: Amazon's algorithm crawls all keywords in slots, including unrelated terms, to index content for search
source_quotes: Amazon is just going to crawl through each one of those slots and it's just going to pick up every single keyword

niche_patterns.description: Combine audience identity, specific needs, and unique constraints for targeted keywords
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Narrow targeting improves discoverability and relevance
source_quotes: Think of how many types of planners exist on Amazon. If you're not being as narrow as you possibly can with your keywords...
